conclusion: Determine position at t = 8s by calculating total displacement and adding to initial position.
Initial position is x = 5 m at t = 0.
Displacement is the area under the v-t graph.
From t = 0 to t = 1s, velocity increases linearly from 0 to 2 m/s, forming a triangle.
Area from t = 0 to t = 1s is 1 m.
From t = 1 to t = 3s, velocity is constant at 2 m/s, forming a rectangle.
Area from t = 1 to t = 3s is 4 m.
From t = 3 to t = 4s, velocity decreases linearly from 2 m/s to 0 m/s, forming a triangle.
Area from t = 3 to t = 4s is 1 m.
From t = 4 to t = 5s, velocity decreases linearly from 0 m/s to -1 m/s, forming a triangle.
Area from t = 4 to t = 5s is -0.5 m.
From t = 5 to t = 7s, velocity is constant at -1 m/s, forming a rectangle.
Area from t = 5 to t = 7s is -2 m.
From t = 7 to t = 8s, velocity increases linearly from -1 m/s to 0 m/s, forming a triangle.
Area from t = 7 to t = 8s is -0.5 m.
